name: Low-Impact Cardio
description: Gentle cardio options for recovery, low-energy days, or joint-friendly exercise

exercises.name: Gentle Walk
exercises.description: Low-intensity walking. Perfect for low-energy days, recovery, or burnout. Movement without stress.
instructions: No warm-up needed - just start walking
Walk at comfortable, relaxed pace
Aim for natural arm swing, relaxed shoulders
Focus on enjoying the movement, not speed or distance
Breathe naturally through nose if comfortable
Notice your surroundings - mindful walking
No pressure to go fast or far - just move

modifications.easier: Shorter duration (10-15 min), slower pace, flat terrain
modifications.harder: Longer duration (40+ min), add light hills, increase pace slightly

conditions.burnout: Perfect for burnout recovery - gentle, no pressure
conditions.mood_low: Fresh air and movement can help mood without demanding effort

exercises.name: Brisk Walk
exercises.description: Purposeful walking at faster pace. Good cardio without running impact. Accessible to everyone.
instructions: Start with 5 minutes easy walking to warm up
Increase pace to brisk walk - breathing harder but can still talk
Pump arms actively, bent at 90 degrees
Take purposeful strides, push off with toes
Keep shoulders back, core engaged
Maintain steady pace throughout
Cool down with 5 minutes easy walking

modifications.easier: Reduce pace, shorter duration (20 min), flat terrain
modifications.harder: Add hills, increase pace to power walk, extend duration (45+ min)

conditions.knee: Excellent low-impact option, ensure good shoes
conditions.ankle: Much easier on ankles than running
conditions.hip: Gentle on hips, good for mobility

exercises.name: Easy Cycling
exercises.description: Low-impact cardio. Easier on joints than running. Good cross-training for runners.
instructions: Start in easy gear, low resistance
Spin at comfortable cadence (70-90 rpm)
Keep effort conversational - should be able to talk
Maintain steady rhythm throughout
Keep shoulders relaxed, core engaged
Adjust seat height so leg nearly straight at bottom of pedal stroke
Cool down last 5 minutes at very easy pace

modifications.easier: Lower resistance, shorter duration (15-20 min), flat route
modifications.harder: Add hills, increase resistance, longer duration (45-60 min)

conditions.knee: Generally knee-friendly, adjust seat height properly
conditions.lower_back: Upright bike better than racing position for back issues

exercises.name: Easy Swimming
exercises.description: Zero-impact full-body cardio. Perfect for injury recovery. Works everything gently.
instructions: Start with easy freestyle (front crawl)
Swim at comfortable, sustainable pace
Focus on smooth strokes, not speed
Breathe regularly every 2-3 strokes
Rest at end of pool if needed - no pressure
Mix strokes if desired (backstroke, breaststroke)
Stop when form breaks down - quality over quantity

modifications.easier: Use kickboard (legs only), water walking, shorter duration
modifications.harder: Increase pace, add intervals, use pull buoy (arms only)

conditions.hip: Water supports body weight, great for hip issues
conditions.shoulder: May need to avoid if severe shoulder pain, try breaststroke

exercises.name: Elliptical Trainer
exercises.description: Very low-impact cardio machine. Good for bad knees. Can adjust intensity easily.
instructions: Step onto machine, hold handles lightly
Start at low resistance, comfortable pace
Use natural stride length - don't overreach
Keep weight in heels, not toes
Engage core, stand tall - don't lean on handles
Push and pull with arms for full-body engagement
Increase resistance gradually if desired

modifications.easier: Lower resistance, shorter duration (15 min), slower pace
modifications.harder: Higher resistance, longer duration (40 min), add intervals

exercises.name: Rowing Machine
exercises.description: Low-impact full-body cardio. Builds strength and endurance. Surprisingly challenging.
instructions: Sit on rower, secure feet in straps
Start position: shins vertical, arms straight, shoulders forward
Drive with legs first, then lean back, then pull arms
Return in reverse: arms extend, lean forward, bend knees
Keep core engaged throughout
Smooth rhythm: legs-body-arms, arms-body-legs
Aim for stroke rate of 20-24 strokes per minute

modifications.easier: Lower resistance (damper 3-5), shorter duration (10-15 min), slower pace
modifications.harder: Higher resistance (damper 6-8), intervals, longer duration (30-40 min)

conditions.lower_back: Can be problematic - focus on leg drive, keep back neutral
conditions.knee: Generally okay, but high knee flexion at catch
conditions.shoulder: Pulling motion may aggravate shoulder issues

exercises.name: Stair Climber / Step Machine
exercises.description: Continuous stair climbing. Builds leg strength and cardio. Can be intense.
instructions: Step onto machine, hold rails lightly for balance
Start at low speed setting
Take full steps - don't stay on toes
Keep torso upright, don't lean heavily on rails
Engage glutes with each step
Maintain steady rhythm
Increase speed gradually if comfortable

modifications.easier: Slower speed, shorter duration (10 min), hold rails more
modifications.harder: Faster speed, longer duration (30 min), minimal rail holding

conditions.knee: Can be hard on knees - use cautiously
conditions.hip: Good for hip strength but can be intense

exercises.name: Water Walking / Aqua Jogging
exercises.description: Walking or jogging in water. Zero impact. Great for injury recovery or hot days.
instructions: Enter pool at chest-deep water
Walk forward using exaggerated arm swings
Lift knees high with each step - water provides resistance
Can progress to jogging motion in place or moving
Water supports your weight - zero joint stress
Use pool noodle or floatation belt for deeper water
Cool and refreshing - perfect for hot days

modifications.easier: Shallower water, slower pace, more walking breaks
modifications.harder: Deeper water (more resistance), faster pace, high knees, add webbed gloves

conditions.knee: Perfect - zero impact, great for rehab
conditions.hip: Water supports weight, ideal for hip issues
